title: Stranger Things title credits spell out 'Hopper is alive' ahead of season 4
text:
Do the Stranger Things credits quite literally reveal Hopper is alive? (Picture: Netflix)

Stranger Things may have confirmed the fate of Jim Hopper right at the very end of season 3 and it was staring at us all this entire time.

The trippy Netflix series, which was renewed for season 4 this week, closed with Joyce (played by Winona Ryder) sacrificing Hopper (David Harbour) to spare Hawkins being taken over by the Mind Flayer and the USSR.

It was devastating. And then, once the credits rolled, we were given another headache as it turned out someone we know only as ‘The American’ is being held captive and will likely be the centre of the story when Stranger Things returns next year.

All the signs are pointing to Hopper (or Barb!), but one eagle-eyed fan has noticed a hidden message in the title credits which quite literally spells out ‘Hopper is alive.’

Coincidence? Possibly, but showrunners The Duffer Brothers are notorious for leaving trails of telling breadcrumbs in the unlikeliest of places.

Matt and Ross Duffer haven’t quite confirmed Hopper’s whereabouts – if he still exists – but they did compare his journey to Han Solo which is a humongous clue if you know your Star Wars.

Hopper can’t be gone, surely? (Picture: Netflix)

‘We always talk about Empire Strikes Back, we always wanted to give him a darker ending, we always wanted to give him a Han Solo sacrifice moment,’ Matt told Entertainment Weekly.

‘It was emotional to shoot but it was really, really quick. David never asked for music but I think we did play some emotional music when we shot David’s final look at Winona [Ryder].’

Han famously came back fighting in Return of The Jedi so, you know, we pray.

Metro.co.uk compiled all the evidence Hopper will be back for season 4, and there’s a lot.

Stranger Things seasons one to three are available to stream on Netflix. Season four is expected to drop in 2020.
